title: Worm
author: Wildbow
synopsis: An introverted teenage girl with an unconventional superpower to control insects, Taylor Hebert goes out in costume to find escape from a deeply unhappy civilian life. Her first attempt at taking down a supervillain sees her mistaken for one, thrusting her into the local cape scene's politics, unwritten rules, and ambiguous morals. As she risks life and limb, Taylor faces the dilemma of having to do the wrong things for the right reasons.
curatorNote: People who finish this fall into two camps: those who won't shut up about it, and those writing fanfic. Taylor goes from a bullied girl shoved into a locker to something that makes gods despair. 1.68 million words sounds scary, but once you hit the Leviathan fight, sleep becomes optional. Here, doing the right thing often costs everything—and this book will ruin other superhero stories for you.

title: Pact
author: Wildbow
synopsis: Blake Thorburn was driven away from home and family by a vicious fight over inheritance, returning only for a deathbed visit with the grandmother who set it in motion. Blake soon finds himself next in line to inherit the property, a trove of dark supernatural knowledge, and the many enemies his grandmother left behind her in the small town of Jacob's Bell.
curatorNote: You're drowning from chapter one. Wildbow gives you no room to breathe. Blake inherits a diabolist family's legacy, and then the entire world wants him dead. Not metaphorically—literally. You'll stare at the ceiling for a while after finishing. Don't read when you're already down, but if you want to feel hunted, this beats any horror movie.

title: Twig
author: Wildbow
synopsis: The year is 1921, and a little over a century has passed since a great mind unraveled the underpinnings of life itself. In this biopunk alternate history, a group of children with extraordinary abilities from the Lambsbridge Orphanage—lab-made experiments deployed as trouble-shooters—navigate a world where the dead walk again, immortality is within reach, and bio-engineered monsters roam the streets.
curatorNote: Wildbow's most underrated work. 1920s biopunk—a group of lab-made Frankenstein children deployed as disposable spies. Dark as hell, but the bonds between these kids are the gentlest thing Wildbow's ever written. Sylvester will move into your heart, and then Wildbow will use him to hurt you. Keep tissues handy.

title: Ward
author: Wildbow
synopsis: Two years after the events of Gold Morning, Victoria Dallon—formerly Glory Girl—seeks to rebuild her life and return to heroism. Having been restored to her original physical form following horrific transformation, she struggles with trauma, broken relationships, and a shattered world while leading a team of troubled young heroes in a city built from the ashes of catastrophe.
curatorNote: This isn't Worm 2—don't come expecting that. Victoria crawls out of the wreckage, trying to rebuild her life. A book about trauma—real trauma that takes time to heal. Slower paced than Worm, which loses some readers. But if you finished Worm wondering 'what next?' and want to see broken people keep living, Ward delivers.

title: Pale
author: Wildbow
synopsis: Three teenagers—Verona, Lucy, and Avery—are awakened as practitioners of magic by a council of supernatural beings in the small Canadian town of Kennet. In exchange for power and knowledge, they are asked to investigate a murder that has shaken the foundations of the local Other community. A modern supernatural mystery where nothing comes for free.
curatorNote: Three high school girls investigating a supernatural murder. Sounds cute, right? It is. It's also terrifying. Wildbow finally learned to let readers breathe—there's warmth, friendship, belonging. But it's still Wildbow, so there's stuff that'll keep you up at night. 1.4 million words, completed. Best entry point into Wildbow.

title: The Last Angel
author: Proximal Flame
synopsis: Two thousand years ago, humanity built the dreadnought Nemesis and its AI, Red One, in a final stand against the alien Compact. Red One destroyed an invincible enemy warship but failed to save Earth from annihilation. Now, damaged but enduring, Red One wages a lonely war of vengeance across the galaxy—until she discovers that humanity survived.
curatorNote: The ceiling of space opera. An AI warship, alone against the empire that exterminated humanity. Two thousand years. Red One hides in deep space, methodically taking revenge, until she discovers humans survived. Revenge or rebuild? This choice will tear you apart. Essential reading if you like Halo or Mass Effect.

title: The Last Angel: Ascension
author: Proximal Flame
synopsis: The sequel to The Last Angel. Red One's vengeance is no longer personal—she ignites rebellion across the sector. The scope expands as more factions emerge and galactic politics come into play, setting the stage for a war that could reshape the galaxy.
curatorNote: The spark becomes wildfire. Red One's vengeance is no longer personal—she's igniting rebellion across the sector. Bigger scope, more factions, galactic politics emerging. Fans of the first won't be disappointed.

title: The Last Angel: The Hungry Stars
author: Proximal Flame
synopsis: The third entry in The Last Angel series. The war has truly begun, and the threats facing both Red One and the surviving humans have escalated beyond the scale of the Compact itself. Ongoing.
curatorNote: The war has just begun. Third in the series, ongoing. The threat now exceeds the Alliance itself. If you've read this far, you don't need anyone's recommendation.

title: Trailblazer
author: 3ndless
synopsis: A Worm/Gundam fusion fic where Taylor, disillusioned with established heroes, becomes an independent hero armed with Gundam-inspired power armor and an AI named Veda. In an alternate Earth Bet where Scion died over a decade ago, she sets out to fix her city and maybe the world—or die trying. 1.6 million words, completed.
curatorNote: The ultimate fusion of mechs and superpowers. Taylor triggers with the ability to build Gundams. Real Gundams. 1.6 million words of epic, grafting Gundam's tech tree perfectly onto Worm's wasteland. Completed, with an ending worthy of the length. The ceiling of Worm crossover fic, bar none.

title: Burn Up
author: JinglyJangles
synopsis: A short, intense Worm fanfic where Taylor triggers with volatile heat-based powers. Her personality ignites along with her abilities in this stream-of-consciousness exploration of power and identity. No complex plots—just pure emotional combustion. 40,000 words, complete.
curatorNote: 40k words. The peak of Worm fanfic prose. Taylor gets volatile heat powers, and her personality ignites with them. No complex plots—just pure emotional combustion. Reads like a bullet heating up—stream-of-consciousness, manic, beautiful. Short, complete, highly recommended.

title: A Wand for Skitter
author: ShayneT
synopsis: Post-Gold Morning Taylor wakes up in the Harry Potter world with her powers intact. Watch as she solves magical Britain's problems with Worm-level ruthlessness and tactical thinking. A decisive, fast-paced crossover that delivers pure satisfaction.
curatorNote: Bug girl hits Hogwarts, and magical Britain trembles. Post-GM Taylor wakes up in the Harry Potter world, powers intact. Solving HP problems with Worm logic—decisive, fast-paced. ShayneT's signature work. Pure satisfaction.

title: Ring-Maker
author: LithosMaitreya
synopsis: A Worm/Lord of the Rings crossover where Taylor can forge Rings of Power. This story honors Tolkien while seamlessly fusing Middle-earth's mythology with Worm's setting. Taylor becomes a figure of redemption in a world that desperately needs hope. Completed.
curatorNote: Sauron's craft, Myrddin's redemption. Taylor can forge Rings of Power. This isn't consuming Tolkien—it's honoring him. The author truly understands Middle-earth and truly understands Worm. Two systems fused seamlessly. Completed, epic as hell.

title: Constellations
author: UnwelcomeStorm
synopsis: Taylor meets a dog that might be a Shinto goddess, or might just be a very good dog. They open a tea shop. A healing fic for those wrecked by Worm's darkness—no gore, no despair, just warmth and found family. Hiatus, but spiritually complete.
curatorNote: The healing fic. Got wrecked by Worm? Come here to recover. Taylor meets a dog. Might be a Shinto goddess, might just be a very good dog. They open a tea shop. No gore, no despair, just warmth. Abandoned but doesn't matter—what exists is spiritually complete.

title: Cenotaph
author: notes
synopsis: After her father dies, Taylor rejects the hero system entirely. No Wards, no trusting anyone—she wages a solitary war as a vigilante in Brockton Bay's shadows. Colder and harder than canon, this begins a landmark trilogy in Worm fanfic.
curatorNote: The lone vigilante trilogy begins. After her father dies, Taylor says no to the hero system. No Wards, no trusting anyone, waging war alone in Brockton Bay's shadows. Colder, harder, more hopeless than canon. A landmark in Worm fanfic.

title: Wake
author: notes
synopsis: Sequel to Cenotaph. Taylor is no longer alone, which means she now has weaknesses. The vigilante war escalates as the stakes and costs mount ever higher.
curatorNote: Cenotaph's sequel. Taylor's no longer alone—which means she has weaknesses now. The war escalates, shadows deepen, costs mount. If you liked the first one's hardboiled style, this won't disappoint.

title: Legacy
author: notes
synopsis: The conclusion to the Cenotaph trilogy. A dark parallel universe reaches its end.
curatorNote: The trilogy ends. Closing out this dark parallel universe. If you've read this far, you don't need a pitch.

title: Copacetic
author: Materia-Blade
synopsis: After Gold Morning, Taylor wants a normal life. She lost her powers, changed her identity, and is trying to start over. But the world remembers what she did, and so does she. A meditation on what happens after the hero retires. Hiatus.
curatorNote: After Golden Morning, Taylor wants a normal life. She lost her powers, changed her identity, trying to start over. But the world remembers what she did, and so does she. A meditation on 'what happens after the hero retires.' Abandoned, but what exists is beautiful.

title: Tabloid
author: babylonsheep
synopsis: A unique angle on the Worm universe: Paul is a paparazzi in a superhero world. He works PRT PR by day and uses his Stranger power to photograph capes for tabloids by night. A gray-zone survivor balancing two lives. Completed, with beautiful illustrations.
curatorNote: The most unique angle: paparazzi in a superhero world. Paul works PRT PR by day, uses his Stranger power to photograph capes for tabloids by night. A gray-zone survivor, balancing two lives. Completed, beautifully illustrated, criminally underrated.

title: Camera Shy
author: TheGreatGimmick
synopsis: Taylor triggers with the ability to turn invisible—but only when no one is looking. A creative exploration of a seemingly weak power used intelligently. Ongoing.
curatorNote: Taylor can turn invisible—but only when no one's looking. Sounds weak, right? But smart powers plus smart application equals endless possibilities. Creative premise, solid execution. Ongoing, worth following.

title: Dire Worm
author: Lost Demiurge
synopsis: Doctor Dire arrives in Brockton Bay! A high-IQ supervillain from another universe stirs everything up with maximum theatrical flair. The character proved so compelling the author wrote original novels about her. Hiatus.
curatorNote: Doctor Dire has arrived! Supervillain, genius, drama queen—all in one. A high-IQ villain from another universe crashes into Brockton Bay, stirring everything with maximum theatrics. Character so compelling the author wrote original novels about her. Abandoned but spectacular.

title: Skein
author: TheGreatGimmick
synopsis: Taylor triggers with language and thought manipulation powers, navigating the cape scene through prediction and psychological control. Not a punching story—an outwitting story with complex, sophisticated prose. Hiatus.
curatorNote: Brain-twister. Taylor gets language and thought manipulation powers, navigating the cape scene through prediction and control. Not a punching story—an outwitting story. Complex, sophisticated prose. Readers who like thinking will be satisfied.

title: Weaver Nine
author: Thinker6
synopsis: What if Taylor was a serial killer? What if Jack Slash was a hero? Identities swapped, but humanity's core unchanged. A chilling dark AU with brilliant mind games. Hiatus.
curatorNote: What if Taylor was a serial killer? What if Jack Slash was a hero? Identities swapped, but humanity's core unchanged. That's what makes it truly chilling. Peak dark AU, brilliant mindgames. Abandoned but worth reading.

title: A Bad Name
author: Ziel
synopsis: An atypical Gamer fic where the protagonist isn't Taylor—it's a homeless addict. After getting the System, the focus isn't grinding levels—it's getting clean, self-redemption, and finding reasons to live. Ongoing.
curatorNote: An atypical Gamer fic. Protagonist isn't Taylor—it's a homeless addict. After getting the System, the focus isn't grinding levels—it's getting clean, self-redemption, finding reasons to live. Unexpectedly moving. Ongoing.

title: Security!
author: Ack
synopsis: An ordinary security guard transmigrates to Worm with plot knowledge. No cheats, no power fantasy—just a middle-aged man trying to do the right thing with foreknowledge. Completed.
curatorNote: An ordinary security guard transmigrates to Worm with plot knowledge. Sounds formulaic, right? But this one actually sells 'normal person in a superpowered world.' No cheats, no flexing—just a middle-aged guy trying to do the right thing. Completed, surprisingly heartfelt.

title: Manager
author: Seraviel
synopsis: Taylor can seize, merge, and redistribute superpowers. She turns heroism into resource management, playing Brockton Bay with multiple identities. Hiatus.
curatorNote: Power management master. Taylor can seize, merge, and redistribute superpowers. She turns heroism into resource management, playing Brockton Bay with multiple identities. Fun premise, abandoned but worth checking out.

title: Intrepid
author: Cerulean
synopsis: After the locker, Taylor falls into a coma. Madison, Emma, and Sophia each trigger and join different factions, their paths destined to converge. A massive multi-POV ensemble drama. Hiatus.
curatorNote: Four girls, four fate lines, destined to converge. After the locker, Taylor falls into a coma. Madison, Emma, Sophia each trigger, joining different factions. They don't know about each other, but readers know they'll reunite. Multi-POV ensemble drama, massive scope, abandoned but content-rich.

title: El-Ahrairah
author: Anderein
synopsis: Taylor gets a Thinker power inspired by the rabbit god from Watership Down. She wins through wisdom and strategy rather than combat. Slower-paced but deep. Hiatus.
curatorNote: The Prince with a Thousand Enemies. Taylor gets a Thinker power inspired by Watership Down's rabbit god. Wins through wisdom and strategy, not combat. Slower paced but deep. Don't miss if you like mindgame stories.

title: Queen of Blood
author: SirWill
synopsis: A Worm/Castlevania crossover. Taylor inherits Dracula's power, bringing gothic horror to Brockton Bay. Gorgeous aesthetic and satisfying combat. Completed.
curatorNote: Vampire queen descends on Brockton Bay. Worm x Castlevania crossover. Taylor inherits Dracula's power—gothic horror meets superheroes. Gorgeous aesthetic, satisfying fights.

title: Worm: More Than Meets the Eye
author: Metallix666
synopsis: Taylor builds Transformers. Giant robots, faction drama, and philosophical questions about personhood and consciousness. Hiatus.
curatorNote: Taylor builds Transformers. Giant robots, faction drama, philosophical questions about personhood. Better crossover fusion than expected, abandoned but fun.

title: Kill Them All
author: ShayneT
synopsis: Taylor gets Gamer powers and goes on a multiverse rampage against everyone who hurt her. Violent, cathartic, unapologetic power fantasy. Completed.
curatorNote: ShayneT product, murder-leveling flow. Taylor gets Gamer powers, slaughtering everyone who hurt her across the multiverse. Violent, cathartic, unapologetic. Come here for power fantasy.

title: Mixed Feelings
author: Kittius
synopsis: The most nuanced trauma psychology in Worm fic. Astrid triggers under her racist father's abuse and is forced into the Wards. A slow-burn story about unlearning hate and learning to trust. Ongoing.
curatorNote: The most nuanced trauma psychology in Worm fic. Astrid triggers under her racist father's abuse, forced into the Wards. This isn't about fights—it's about a girl raised on hate learning to shed those chains, trust again, redefine herself. Slow burn, 700k words of gradual healing, but the characters feel painfully real.

title: Atonement
author: Cerulean
synopsis: What if Taylor died in the locker? Madison, crushed by guilt, triggers powers and becomes a hero not for glory, but to fill the void she created. Called 'the best Spider-Man story, just set in Worm.' Hiatus.
curatorNote: What if Taylor died in the locker? In this timeline, Taylor had a heart attack, didn't survive. Madison is crushed by guilt, triggers powers. She puts on a costume not to be a hero, but to fill the hole she dug herself. Called 'the best Spider-Man story, just set in Worm.'

title: Memories of Iron
author: becuzitswrong
synopsis: Taylor receives Tony Stark's memories and technology. Iron Man meets Worm in this tech-stomp satisfaction piece. The author passed away, leaving it incomplete—a legacy worth remembering.
curatorNote: Taylor gets Tony Stark's memories and tech. Iron Man x Worm. Tech-stomp satisfaction, well-written. Sadly, the author passed away—it'll never be finished. As a legacy, worth reading and remembering.

title: I Woke Up As a Dungeon, Now What?
author: Aku-dono
synopsis: Taylor becomes a dungeon core in an isekai world. Farming, trap-building, and monster management with a creative premise and fun execution. Hiatus.
curatorNote: Taylor becomes a dungeon core. Farming, trap-building, monster management in an isekai. Creative premise, fun execution. Abandoned but charming.

title: Acceleration
author: chibipoe
synopsis: Taylor gets Accelerator's power from A Certain Magical Index—the strongest ability in physics. An invincible power fantasy watching her crush everything. Completed.
curatorNote: Taylor gets Accelerator's power. Strongest in physics. Invincible power fantasy, watching her crush everything. Completed, though the ending's a bit rushed.

title: Hunter
author: UnwelcomeStorm
synopsis: Bloodborne meets Worm. Taylor inherits the Hunter's Dream, bringing gothic horror and cosmic dread to Brockton Bay. Hiatus.
curatorNote: Bloodborne x Worm. Taylor inherits the Hunter's Dream. Gothic horror, cosmic dread, oversized weapons. If you've played Bloodborne, you'll love this.

title: Amelia
author: TanaNari
synopsis: When two biokinetics team up, power creep never stops. Taylor and Amy's partnership derails the timeline completely as they escalate without limits. Completed.
curatorNote: When two biokinetics team up, power creep never stops. Taylor and Amy's partnership goes from cooperation to codependence, derailing the timeline completely. Completed, content-rich, but be warned—the escalation has no brakes.

title: Deputy
author: Reyemile
synopsis: Taylor joins the PRT as civilian staff—not a Ward, but a deputy. She works within the system, solving problems through proper channels. A surprisingly compelling bureaucracy fic. Completed.
curatorNote: Taylor joins the PRT as civilian staff. Not a Ward—a deputy. Working within the system, solving problems through proper channels, showing heroes 'how it's done.' Bureaucracy fic, surprisingly compelling.

title: Heromaker's Legacy
author: TheGrum
synopsis: Infrastructure fic taken to extremes. Taylor discovers alien technology and proceeds to manufacture, test, and upgrade endlessly. For those who love watching power stats explode. Ongoing.
curatorNote: Infrastructure fic taken to extremes. Taylor triggers bug control, then discovers alien tech infrastructure. Manufacturing, testing, upgrading—numbers going up constantly. If you like watching power stats explode, this is for you.

title: A Cloudy Path
author: LacksCreativity
synopsis: Supreme Commander meets Worm. Taylor gets sci-fi RTS manufacturing abilities, embodying the escalation fic as she builds an army. Hiatus.
curatorNote: Supreme Commander x Worm. Taylor gets sci-fi RTS manufacturing abilities. The embodiment of escalation fic, farming to the sky. Abandoned, but the journey is the destination.

title: Purple Days
author: Baurus
synopsis: Joffrey Baratheon dies at the Purple Wedding and wakes up three days after Jon Arryn's death—again and again. Through countless deaths and rebirths, the most hated character in Westeros is forged into something changed. A redemption epic exploring the entire ASOIAF world. Completed, Turtledove 2017 winner.
curatorNote: Joffrey's time loop. Yes, that Joffrey. He dies at the Purple Wedding, wakes up to start over. Once, twice, hundreds of times. Pain grinds down edges and forges new souls. 2017 Turtledove winner, proving any character can be redeemed through enough suffering.

title: The Games We Play
author: Ryuugi
synopsis: The ceiling of RWBY Gamer fic. Jaune Arc gets the power to live life as an RPG and levels up to fighting gods. 700,000 words, completed.
curatorNote: The ceiling of RWBY Gamer fic. Jaune Arc gets the power to live life as an RPG, then levels up to fighting gods. Million words, completed. If you like watching numbers go up, this will satisfy.

title: Seventh Horcrux
author: Emerald Ashes
synopsis: The funniest Harry Potter fic ever written. Harry is actually Voldemort's seventh Horcrux—and the soul fragment took over. Now 'Harry' must pretend to be a normal student while being deeply confused by everyone around him. Completed.
curatorNote: The funniest Harry Potter fic ever written. Harry is actually Voldemort's seventh Horcrux—and the soul fragment took over. Now 'Harry' must pretend to be a normal student while being deeply confused by everyone around him. Non-stop gold, laugh-until-it-hurts funny.

title: A Practical Guide to Evil
author: ErraticErrata
synopsis: Catherine Foundling joins the Legions of Terror to save her conquered homeland from within. In a world where narrative tropes have literal power, she'll do wrong things for right reasons—or is she just rationalizing? A completed 1.3 million word epic about fate, politics, and punching the rules. Published on Amazon.
curatorNote: A villain's practical guide. Catherine Foundling joins the legions of evil, because sometimes the only way to save your country is to conquer it. 2 million word epic about fate, narrative tropes, and punching the rules. Recently published on Amazon.

title: Forge of Destiny
author: Yrsillar
synopsis: Cultivation done right. Ling Qi, a street urchin, enters a cultivation sect. No face-slapping, no broken engagements—just politics, friendship, and very good music. A Quest-turned-novel balancing progression with character growth. Published on Amazon.
curatorNote: Cultivation done right. Ling Qi, a street urchin, enters a cultivation sect. No face-slapping, no broken engagements—just politics, friendship, and very good music. Quest-to-novel transition that balances progression with character growth. Published on Amazon.

title: Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality
author: Eliezer Yudkowsky
synopsis: What if Harry was raised by a scientist? Petunia married an Oxford professor, and Harry grew up on the scientific method. Now Rationalist!Harry enters the wizarding world armed with Enlightenment ideals and the experimental spirit. The foundational rationalist fic—smart, arrogant, utterly unique. Completed.
curatorNote: What if Harry was a scientist? Petunia married a professor, Harry grew up on the scientific method, now he wants to figure out magic's underlying logic. The foundational rationalist fic—smart, arrogant, utterly unique. Loved or hated, never forgotten.

title: Marked for Death
author: EagleJarl & Velorien
synopsis: A squad of Mist genin, sent on suicide missions as cannon fodder, choose to run instead. Now they're missing-nin, hunted by Bloody Mist. Not shonen—this is child soldiers, political sacrifice, and survival simulation. The longest-running Quest on SV, peak rationalist Naruto. Ongoing.
curatorNote: Children abandoned by their village. A squad of Mist genin sent on suicide missions as cannon fodder choose to run instead. Now they're missing-nin, hunted by Bloody Mist. Not shonen—this is child soldiers, political sacrifice, and survival simulation. SV's longest-running Quest, peak rationalist Naruto.

title: Dungeon Keeper Ami
author: Pusakuronu
synopsis: Sailor Mercury's Ami is forced to run an evil dungeon. She wants to be good, but her job description says demon lord. Moral dilemmas and rational decisions in a dark system. Mega-length, ongoing.
curatorNote: Sailor Mercury's Ami, forced to run an evil dungeon. She wants to be good, but her job description says demon lord. Moral dilemmas, rational decisions, holding the line in a dark system. Mega-length, still ongoing.

title: The Wandering Inn
author: pirateaba
synopsis: Erin Solstice opens an inn in another world. In a dangerous LitRPG setting where magic is real and people level up, she is no warrior, no mage—she's an [Innkeeper]. At 12+ million words, it's the longest English web novel, exploring community and belonging. Published on Amazon.
curatorNote: 12 million words. The longest web novel in English. Erin Solstice opens an inn in another world. That's the premise. But this inn becomes sanctuary, battlefield, home. Cozy, vast, about community and belonging. 18 volumes on Amazon. If you want to completely immerse in a world, this is your door.

title: The World As It Appears To Be
author: Benedict_SC
synopsis: Rationalist Overwatch. Mercy can backup and restore teammates' complete consciousness. When the secret gets out, everyone faces the question: if you copy someone's memories, are they still alive? Hardcore sci-fi ensemble. Completed.
curatorNote: Rationalist Overwatch. Mercy's tech is more advanced than anyone realizes—she can backup and restore teammates' complete consciousness. When the secret gets out, everyone faces the question: if you copy someone's memories, are they still alive? Hardcore sci-fi ensemble.

title: CORDYCEPS: Too clever for their own good
author: Benedict_SC
synopsis: Psychological horror. You wake up in a facility with no memory. Something's wrong. Don't look anything up—just read. Every twist is earned. Best experienced blind. Completed.
curatorNote: Psychological horror. Short, sharp, dirty. You wake up in a facility with no memory. Something's wrong. Don't look anything up—just read. Every twist is earned. Best experienced blind.

title: Pokemon: The Origin of Species
author: DaystarEld
synopsis: Pokemon world taken seriously. Red, Blue, and Leaf's journey, but Pokemon are scientifically studied and trainers face real moral dilemmas. Rationalist, ongoing.
curatorNote: Pokemon world, taken seriously. Red, Blue, and Leaf's journey, but Pokemon are scientifically studied and trainers face real moral dilemmas. Rationalist, ongoing, substantial depth.

title: Blood of the Frontier
author: Magoose
synopsis: Crusader Kings politics in novel form. Medieval dynasty struggles, frontier survival, and imperial ruthlessness. A Quest for those who love grand strategy scheming and gray morality. Completed.
curatorNote: Crusader Kings politics in novel form. Medieval dynasty struggles, frontier survival, imperial ruthlessness. If you like grand strategy games' scheming and gray morality, this hits the spot.

title: Contact at Kobol
author: wilkins75
synopsis: The Colonial Fleet finds Earth—but it's Stargate's Earth. Battlestar Galactica meets Stargate in a military sci-fi crossover where Asgard-enhanced Earth meets desperate survivors. Completed.
curatorNote: The Colonial Fleet finds Earth—but it's Stargate's Earth. Two sci-fi universes collide. Earth with Asgard tech is overwhelming firepower against the Colonials. Military sci-fi crossover that satisfies both fandoms.

title: The Perfect Run
author: Maxime J. Durand (Void Herald)
synopsis: Ryan 'Quicksave' Romano is an eccentric adventurer with a strange power: he can create a save-point in time and redo his life whenever he dies. Arriving in New Rome, the glitzy capital of sin of a rebuilding Europe, he finds the city torn between mega-corporations, sponsored heroes, superpowered criminals, and true monsters.
curatorNote: Deadpool meets Groundhog Day in post-apocalyptic Europe. Ryan's humor hides centuries of trauma, and watching him finally find people worth saving hits different. The trilogy sticks the landing perfectly.

title: The Menocht Loop
author: Lorne Ryburn (caerulex)
synopsis: Ian Dunai is trapped in the only maze an arch-decemancer can't escape: Time. Only 1% of the population is blessed with magic affinity at birth. Ian's decemancy eclipses all, granting him ultimate control over Death. He conquers cities with a thought—but overwhelming power isn't enough to escape the time loop.
curatorNote: What happens AFTER the loop? Most time loop stories end when the protagonist escapes. This one asks: what does a god-tier looper do with all that power in the real world? Six books, ongoing on Royal Road.

title: The Years of Apocalypse
author: UraniumPhoenix
synopsis: Mirian Castrella, a student in her final year of a magical academy, unexpectedly finds herself caught in a time loop and haunted by strange dreams of the Elder Gods. Her plan had been to become an artificer to support her struggling family, but when the Akana Praediar army betrays her country in a surprise attack, everything changes.
curatorNote: The true spiritual successor to Mother of Learning. Magic academy, time loops, gradual mastery—but with a fresh voice and a female protagonist who earns every ounce of power. Currently the best ongoing time loop story.

title: Dear Spellbook
author: Peter J. Lee
synopsis: Tal is a sorcerer masquerading as a wizard, searching for answers about his parents' mysterious deaths. When the same day starts repeating, he's the only one aware—and his previously useless Spellbook is starting to exhibit strange abilities that could be his key to escaping this temporal prison.
curatorNote: The journal format works brilliantly here—you ARE the spellbook. Cozy mystery meets time loop, with a magic system that rewards curiosity. Travis Baldree narrates the audiobook.

title: Re: Monarch
author: Eligos
synopsis: Cairn is a prince already tired of ruling. Faced with an imminent coronation and an overbearing father, he wants nothing more than to drown his responsibilities in cheap liquor. But an invasion, conspiracy, and rise of a terrifying villain result in his untimely death. Then, Cairn reawakens—a decade in the past, in his childhood body.
curatorNote: Time loop meets political intrigue. The twist? Your killer loops with you. Cairn's growth from drunken wastrel to competent ruler feels earned. Luke Daniels narrates the audiobook.

title: Blessed Time
author: Cale Plamann (CoCop)
synopsis: On Karell, you are either blessed by the gods or forgotten. Micah Silver was chosen for greatness—his primary blessing allows him to travel five years into the past by sacrificing his class, wealth, and levels. A psychological burden he's reluctant to shoulder. But fate has a way of forcing you to face your destiny.
curatorNote: CoCop delivers again. The cost of each loop—losing everything you've built—creates real stakes. Micah's reluctance to use his power makes him more human than most time loop protagonists. Complete series.

title: Stubborn Skill Grinder in a Time Loop
author: X-RHODEN-X
synopsis: Orodan was an orphaned street rat who clawed his way to the county militia. When calamitous events unfold, his battle-loving disposition leads to a warrior's death—only to wake up again. A smart time-looper would scheme and plan. But not Orodan. He'll batter walls with his head thousands of times till either the wall breaks or he does.
curatorNote: Brain off, skill grind on. Orodan is gloriously simple: see wall, headbutt wall, gain skill levels. The comedy comes from applying this philosophy to increasingly cosmic problems. 750K+ words of pure power fantasy comfort food.
